article.title: TeleCommunication Systems to Ship Deployable Satellite Solutions Under Army SNAP Program
article.author: Katie Packard
article.text: TeleCommunication Systems Incorporated has received a $23.4 million follow-on order for deployable satellite solutions under its Secure Internet Protocol Router (SIPR) and Non-secure Internet Protocol Router (NIPR) Access Point (SNAP) Very Small Aperture Terminal Satellite Systems Program. This U.S. Army Communications-Electronics Life Cycle Management Command Program has a potential value of $246 million if fully funded.
